question.title: What's the right way to configure the directories with WireMock?
question.body:
My resources tree is

src/test/resources/
├── application-test.yml
└── wiremock
    ├── __files
    │   ├── github-repo-branches.json
    │   └── github-user-repos.json
    └── mappings
        ├── github-repo-branches.json
        └── github-user-repos.json

I want WireMock to use those mappings and files but it refuses to see them

2025-08-16T11:39:48.471+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory wiremock\wiremock... 
2025-08-16T11:39:48.471+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory stubs\wiremock... 
2025-08-16T11:39:48.471+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory mappings\wiremock... 
2025-08-16T11:39:48.472+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory wiremock... 
2025-08-16T11:39:48.472+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory stubs... 
2025-08-16T11:39:48.472+02:00 INFO 25080 --- [demo] [ Test worker] c.w.s.i.WireMockServerCreator wiremock : Looking for mocks in directory mappings...

My test is configured as

@EnableWireMock
@ConfigureWireMock(filesUnderClasspath = "wiremock")
class GithubRepositoryIntegrationTest {

I also tried to use filesUnderDirectory but the docs is vaguely almost the same, I don't get the difference between them. I ended up moving the wiremock directory to my project root directory and from then on it works but I don't like it. I want wiremock to be located under test/resources.

Someone nests @ConfigureWireMock inside of @EnableWireMock in the Github issue. Is it the preferred way to configure it in the declarative way? I don't like the programmatic way.
